intro: Psychotria pittieri subsp. oinochrophylla, commonly known as the golden-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its striking golden-yellow leaves, which contrast with its dark green stems and small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
